Cooking Steps: Step 1: Wash and soak the rice for 20 minutes.

Step 2: Heat a deep pot, add oil. Add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, bay leaf and let it crackle. Add the onions and start sauteeing it. Add curry leaves, green chillies and saute till the onions turn golden brown. Add chopped coriander and mint leaves and saute for a few seconds. Add the tomatoes and cook till they turn soft.
Step 3: Add the chicken and the cookd chettinad masala and mix for 2 minutes. Add curd and give it a good mix. Add water, bring it to a boil. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.

Step 4: Open the pot, add the soaked and strained rice. Cook till the rice and water are level. Cover the pot with a fitting lid. Keep it on a preheated tawa for 15 minutes on a low flame. Turn off the flame after 15 minutes and let it rest for 10 minutes. Open the pot, add ghee, fluff the biryani and serve it hot.
Step 1: Wash the rice and soak it for 15 minutes.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and bay leaves.
Step 3: Add chopped onions, carrots, beans, and peas, and sauté for 5 minutes.
Step 4: Add the soaked rice and water, and cook covered for 20 minutes until rice is done.

Step 1: Roast all the whole spices in a little bit of groundnut oil until fragrant. In a bit of oil, add the chana dal and rice. Toast until lightly golden for 1-2 minutes on low heat. Remove the chana dal and rice mixture, reserving the oil in the pan.

Step 2: In the remaining oil, add the dry red chilies and curry leaves. Sauté for 1 minute on medium heat until fragrant, then remove from the pan. Blend all broiled ingredients into a powder and set aside.

Step 3: In a preheated kadai, add groundnut oil. Once hot, add shallots and sauté on medium heat for around 5-6 minutes or until softened. Turn off the flame, add grated coconut and the spice powder, and stir for 1 minute. Remove from the kadai and blend this mixture into a fine paste, adding water as needed.

Step 4: In a fresh preheated kadai, add groundnut oil. Once hot, add shallots and cook on medium heat for around 5 minutes or until softened. Add curry leaves, dry red chilies, and ginger garlic paste. Once the raw flavor fades, add chicken and sauté for 2 minutes until the water from the chicken evaporates.
Step 5: Add salt, turmeric, the remaining spice powder, and the shallot paste, mixing to combine.
Step 6: Add water, bring to a simmer, and cook the chicken for 10 minutes.
Step 1: Score and marinate the chicken with salt, black pepper powder, and lemon juice.
Step 2: Heat a pan, add butter and sear the chicken on a medium-low flame for 4 minutes on each side, then remove from the pan.

Step 3: In the same pan, add butter and let it melt. Add chopped garlic and sauté until it turns light brown. Add water and mix until the residue sticking on the pan is clear. Add salt, black pepper powder, and more butter, mixing on low flame until combined into a sauce.
Step 4: Add the seared chicken and baste it with the sauce. Cook for 5 minutes on low flame and serve hot with bread or buttered rice.

Step 1: Marinate the fish in the ingredients mentioned, except for the cornstarch and maida. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes and up to overnight. Just before deep frying, coat the fish in cornstarch and maida to make a thick, pasty coating.
Step 2: Deep fry on high heat until crispy, around 3 minutes.
Step 3: In a separate pan, add oil. Once hot, add onions and green chillies. Sauté for 4-5 minutes or until soft and translucent. Add the ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Step 4: Add the red chili powder, turmeric powder, and coriander powder. Sauté for 2 minutes on medium heat. Deglaze with soy sauce.
Step 5: Add the fried fish pieces and toss to combine well. Turn off the flame before adding lemon juice.
Step 1: In a pot, sauté garlic and green chilli in extra virgin oil. Once aromatic, add the dried oregano and dried rosemary and cook for 1 minute.

Step 2: Add the tomatoes and basil leaves. Cook on medium heat for 10-15 minutes. The tomatoes will soften and start to become mushy. Add sugar and salt to balance the flavors. Once the sauce is done cooking, add the olives.
Step 3: In a deep pot, add water to cook the pasta. Once boiling, add salt along with the pasta. Cook the pasta 1 minute less than package instructions.
Step 4: Add the pasta to the sauce and finish cooking the pasta for 1 minute, adding pasta water as needed. Toss the pasta well to emulsify the sauce.
Step 5: Grate in parmesan cheese and toss once again to combine well.

Step 1: Toast the urad dal in a pan on medium heat until deeply golden brown. Allow it to cool for a minute before adding it to a blender along with roasted chana dal. Blend until it is a fine powder.

Step 2: In a bowl, add all the ingredients required for the thatta vadai. Then strain the urad dal mixture and add it to the bowl. Add water and knead it into a smooth dough. Portion out the dough into small, even-sized balls.

Step 3: Lightly oil 2 small banana leaves. Place one of the balls between the two leaves and apply even pressure using a flat surface like a dabrah. Press down into a circle that is of an even thickness of around ½ cm. Deep fry them in hot oil until they are deeply golden brown and crispy. Remove them from the oil and drain on paper towels.

Step 4: To a mortar and pestle, add garlic, shallots, and dry red chilli. Process them until they have been crushed and are fragrant. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and add sesame seeds and salt. In a pan, heat coconut oil until it is hot and just smoking. Pour this hot oil into the bowl and let it steep.

Step 5: To a pan, add oil. Once hot, add the shallots and garlic. Sauté for 3 minutes, or until lightly golden and starting to soften. Then add the dry red chilli and toast for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the tomatoes and cook on high heat for 5-6 minutes. The tomatoes will become soft and mushy. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly before blending into a smooth paste.
Step 6: Add all the ingredients required into a blender and blend until a smooth chutney is formed.
Step 7: Grate everything and toss.
Step 1: Heat a frying pan, add oil, and fry the egg well on both sides.
Step 2: To assemble the sandwich, apply mayonnaise on 2 slices of bread. Add sliced onion, tomato, and cucumber. Place the fried egg on top, add a cheese slice, and close the sandwich.
Step 3: Heat a pan/tawa, add butter, and toast the sandwich on medium flame until golden and crispy. Add butter to the pan, flip the sandwich, and repeat the same. Cut and serve hot.
Step 1: Heat coconut oil on medium heat. Add the curry leaves. Once they splatter, add in the onions. Add salt and cook on medium heat until the onions turn golden brown and have softened.
Step 2: Add the spice powders to the onions and let them cook for 30 seconds before adding the garlic and ginger. Once aromatic, add the crushed whole black pepper along with the fish. Mix once.

Step 3: Add the water and cook until all the water has been reduced to form a thick semi-dry gravy. Add the rest of the crushed black pepper and mix gently to combine. Garnish with lemon juice and coriander leaves.

Step 1: In a pan, pour coconut oil and add fennel seeds and dry red chillies. Once fragrant, add onions and sauté on moderate flame until translucent (around 1 minute). Add ginger garlic paste, mushrooms, and all the powdered spices except salt. Cook on high flame for 3-4 minutes or until all the water evaporates.
Step 2: Add masalas and then salt, black pepper, curry leaves, and the cooked basmati rice. Toss gently and serve hot.
Step 1: Wash and soak the rice for 10 minutes.
Step 2: In a pressure cooker, add water, soaked rice, and pressure cook it for 10 minutes.
Step 3: Heat ghee in a kadai, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Step 4: Add split urad dal, chana dal, and sauté for a minute.
Step 5: Add fennel seeds, green chilli, curry leaves, ginger-garlic paste, onion, and sauté till it turns translucent.
Step 6: Add tomato and sauté for 2 minutes.
Step 7: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, asafoetida, salt, and sauté till the masalas get cooked.
Step 8: Add the cooked rice and mix well without breaking the rice.
Step 9: Add coriander leaves, mix and remove from heat. Serve hot with onion raita/appalam.
Step 1: Mix the ingredients for the batter to form a batter, coat the cubed paneer in the batter, and deep fry. Set aside.
Step 2: In a pan, add oil, garlic, and ginger, and sauté for 30 seconds.
Step 3: Add spring onion whites, cubed onion, capsicum, and green chilli, and sauté for 1 minute.
Step 4: Add soy sauce, red chilli sauce, tomato ketchup, chilli powder, vinegar, sugar, pepper powder, and salt. Add spring onion greens.
Step 5: Mix cornflour and water to prepare a thickening agent. Add the thickening agent to the sauce mixture and prepare the sauce to the desired thickness.
Step 6: Add the batter-fried paneer cubes and toss.
Step 7: Garnish with chopped spring onion greens and serve as an appetizer.
Step 1: Soak the cashews in water for 15 minutes.
Step 2: Blend the soaked cashews in a mixer grinder with the water in which they were soaking.
Step 3: Roughly chop the tomatoes into cubes and grind into a smooth puree. Keep aside.
Step 4: In a pan on medium heat, add butter and bay leaf.
Step 5: Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a few seconds, then add the tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Step 6: Add Kashmiri red chilli powder and continue cooking until most of the water from the tomato puree is evaporated.
Step 7: Add the cashew paste and cook for a further 3 minutes.
Step 8: Add 1.5 cups of water and simmer the gravy for 5 minutes.
Step 9: Add salt to taste and sugar to the gravy, then add the Garam Masala powder and crushed Kasuri Methi.
Step 10: Once the gravy thickens to the desired consistency, add the paneer cubes and finally the fresh cream.
Step 11: Mix well and switch off the flame.
Step 1: Marinate the paneer in the ingredients given for marination for 10 minutes.
Step 2: Heat oil and add the onions, sauté until golden brown.
Step 3: Add the green chillies and ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. Add the tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 4: Add the diced capsicum and mix well. Add the powdered spices and salt and mix well.
Step 5: Add ¼ cup of water and cook the masala for 3 minutes.
Step 6: Add the marinated paneer and cook for 5 minutes until dry and the masala coats the paneer.
Step 7: Finish with butter, chopped mint, and coriander leaves.
Step 1: In a bowl, add 2 tsp of soy sauce, ginger garlic paste, black pepper powder, red chilli powder, salt, and egg. Mix everything together.
Step 2: Add the chicken lollipop pieces to the same bowl and mix well.
Step 3: Add cornflour and maida to the same bowl. Add 2 tbsp of water and mix until a batter is formed around the lollipop pieces.
Step 4: In a deep-frying pan, heat oil and deep-fry the battered lollipop pieces for 7 mins or until a crispy coating is formed outside and the chicken is cooked well.
Step 5: In a pan, add 2 tsp of oil, add the finely chopped onion, and sauté for 1 minute.
Step 6: Add the finely chopped ginger and garlic. Continue to sauté for 30 seconds.
Step 7: Add red chilli sauce, tomato sauce, soy sauce, black pepper powder, and salt.
Step 8: Add 2 tbsp of water and continue to cook for one minute, then add 1 tbsp spring onions.
Step 9: Reduce the flame to low and add the deep-fried lollipop pieces. Toss until the sauce coats the lollipop pieces.
Step 10: Wrap the bone part with aluminum foil. Garnish with chopped spring onions and serve hot.
Step 1: Take sugar and water in a pan and bring it to boil. Add saffron strands and cardamom powder once the syrup comes to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes; the syrup consistency shouldn’t be too thick.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the Khova, maida, baking powder, and cardamom powder.
Step 3: Start mixing it together to form a dough by adding sprinkles of water.
Step 4: Once the mixture becomes a firm dough ball, make smooth, crack-free balls of dough using your palm. Refrigerate for 10 minutes.

Step 5: Heat the oil to a medium-low temperature in a deep frying pan. Add the dough balls in the oil and fry for 6-7 minutes on medium-low heat. The outside should turn golden brown and the inside should also be cooked. Frying on high heat will prevent it from being cooked inside.
Step 6: Cool the fried Jamuns for 5 mins and add them to the warm sugar syrup. After 3-4 hours of soaking inside the syrup at room temperature, the jamuns are ready to be served.
Step 1: In a thick-bottomed pan, heat ghee. Once the ghee is hot, add cashews and raisins. Once the raisins puff and the cashews become golden brown, remove them from the pan.
Step 2: In the same pan, add the grated carrots and sauté for 10 minutes, stirring well.
Step 3: Add the milk, mix with the carrots, and let it simmer on low heat until the milk is absorbed.
Step 4: Add the Khova, sugar, and cardamom powder, and mix well until everything dissolves. Increase the heat to high and sauté for 8 minutes, stirring continuously.
Step 5: Add the cashews and raisins. Remove from the heat and serve the halwa warm.
Step 1: Heat oil in a wok, add ginger, garlic, and shallots, and sauté for a few seconds.
Step 2: Add the carrot and beans. Toss them on high flame for a few seconds.
Step 3: Add the diced mushroom, toss it. If it releases water, cook until all the water evaporates.
Step 4: Add the cooked rice. Toss until all ingredients combine evenly.
Step 5: Add the salt, pepper, soy sauce, and MSG. Add spring onions. Toss and mix well.
Step 6: Transfer to a bowl, garnish with spring onions, and serve hot.
Step 1: Knead a soft dough with the flour and water, cover, and rest for 20 minutes.
Step 2: For the stuffing, heat oil in a pan over medium heat and add ginger, garlic, and onion; sauté until onions are translucent.
Step 3: Add the cabbage, broccoli, and carrot. Mix well.
Step 4: Add salt, pepper, and soy sauce. Cook for 5 minutes. Finish with MSG and chopped spring onion.
Step 5: Divide the dough and roll out small roundels, stuff with the mixture, and seal the edges to form a semi-circle.
Step 6: Steam the momos for 6 minutes.
Step 1: Finely chop the prawns on a cutting board. Optionally, pulse in a food processor. Add all filling ingredients to the prawns and mix well.

Step 2: Prepare the spring roll sheets. Lay out a spring roll wrapper and place the filling near the top corner. Roll tightly to form a spring roll. Seal by mixing flour with water to create a paste and applying it to the final corner.
Step 3: In a pan, heat enough oil to cover the surface. Once hot, add the spring rolls and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes on each side.
Step 4: For the dipping sauce, mix all the ingredients listed.
Step 1: Cook the prawns until they are half cooked in a pan with turmeric powder and 1 tbsp of coconut oil.
Step 2: Dry roast the fennel seeds, coriander seeds, cumin, and black peppercorns, then grind into a fine powder.
Step 3: In a pan, add 1 tbsp of coconut oil. Add shallots and finely chopped ginger and garlic, cooking until golden brown.
Step 4: Add the half-cooked prawns and toss in the ground spices, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and curry leaves. Mix well until the raw smell from the spices has disappeared.
Step 5: Serve hot as an appetizer.
